verses.kjv: And it came to pass after many days, that the word of the LORD came to Elijah in the third year, saying, Go, shew thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.
verses.web: After many days, LORD’s word came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, show yourself to Ahab; and I will send rain on the earth.”
verses.ct: After many days, in the 3rd year of the drought, the LORD spoke to Elijah: "Go and present yourself to Ahab. I'm going to send rain on the land."

verses.kjv: And Elijah went to shew himself unto Ahab. And there was a sore famine in Samaria.
verses.web: Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. The famine was severe in Samaria.
verses.ct: So Elijah set out to appear before Ahab. By this time, the famine in Samaria was devastating.

verses.kjv: And Ahab called Obadiah, which was the governor of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly:
verses.web: Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared LORD greatly;
verses.ct: Ahab summoned Obadiah, who managed the royal household. Now Obadiah deeply feared the LORD.

verses.kjv: For it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the LORD, that Obadiah took an hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)
verses.web: for when Jezebel cut off LORD’s prophets, Obadiah took one hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)
verses.ct: When Jezebel had been slaughtering the LORD's prophets, Obadiah had secretly taken 100 of them and hidden them in two caves — 50 in each — and kept them alive with bread and water.

verses.kjv: And Ahab said unto Obadiah, Go into the land, unto all fountains of water, and unto all brooks: peradventure we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.
verses.web: Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go through the land, to all the springs of water, and to all the brooks. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the animals.”
verses.ct: Ahab told Obadiah, "Search the whole land — every spring and every stream. Maybe we can find enough grass to keep the horses and mules alive so we don't lose all our animals."

verses.kjv: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
verses.web: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it. Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
verses.ct: They split the territory between them. Ahab went one direction by himself, and Obadiah went the other direction by himself.

verses.kjv: And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Art thou that my lord Elijah?
verses.web: As Obadiah was on the way, behold, Elijah met him. He recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, “Is it you, my lord Elijah?”
verses.ct: While Obadiah was traveling along, Elijah suddenly appeared in front of him. Obadiah recognized him immediately, dropped to the ground, and said, "Is it really you, my lord Elijah?"

verses.kjv: And he answered him, I am: go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
verses.web: He answered him, “It is I. Go, tell your lord, ‘Behold, Elijah is here!’ ”
verses.ct: "It's me," Elijah replied. "Go tell your master, 'Elijah is here.'"

verses.kjv: And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?
verses.web: He said, “How have I sinned, that you would deliver your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?
verses.ct: Obadiah protested, "What have I done wrong that you would send me to my death? Ahab will kill me!"

verses.kjv: As the LORD thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, He is not there; he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.
verses.web: As LORD your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek you. When they said, ‘He is not here,’ he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they didn’t find you.
verses.ct: "As the LORD your God lives, there isn't a nation or kingdom where my master hasn't sent people looking for you. And when each one said, 'He's not here,' Ahab made them swear an oath that they truly hadn't found you.

verses.kjv: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
verses.web: Now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here.” ’
verses.ct: Now you're telling me to go say, 'Elijah is here'?

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of the LORD shall carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but I thy servant fear the LORD from my youth.
verses.web: It will happen, as soon as I leave you, that LORD’s Spirit will carry you I don’t know where; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he can’t find you, he will kill me. But I, your servant, have feared LORD from my youth.
verses.ct: The moment I leave you, the spirit of the LORD will carry you off to who knows where. When I tell Ahab and he comes but can't find you, he'll kill me! And I've feared the LORD since I was young.

verses.kjv: Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the LORD, how I hid an hundred men of the LORD’s prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
verses.web: Wasn’t it told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed LORD’s prophets, how I hid one hundred men of LORD’s prophets with fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
verses.ct: Hasn't anyone told you what I did when Jezebel was killing the LORD's prophets? I hid 100 of the LORD's prophets in two caves — 50 in each — and supplied them with bread and water.

verses.kjv: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here: and he shall slay me.
verses.web: Now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here”.’ He will kill me.”
verses.ct: And now you want me to go tell my master, 'Elijah is here'? He'll kill me!"

verses.kjv: And Elijah said, As the LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely shew myself unto him to day.
verses.web: Elijah said, “As LORD of Armies lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today.”
verses.ct: Elijah answered, "As the LORD of Armies lives — the one I serve — I swear I will present myself to Ahab today."

verses.kjv: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him: and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
verses.web: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
verses.ct: So Obadiah went and found Ahab and told him. Then Ahab went out to meet Elijah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto him, Art thou he that troubleth Israel?
verses.web: When Ahab saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, “Is that you, you troubler of Israel?”
verses.ct: The moment Ahab saw Elijah, he said, "So there you are — the man who's been causing all this trouble in Israel!"

verses.kjv: And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father’s house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the LORD, and thou hast followed Baalim.
verses.web: He answered, “I have not troubled Israel; but you, and your father’s house, in that you have forsaken LORD’s commandments, and you have followed the Baals.
verses.ct: Elijah fired back, "I haven't caused Israel's trouble. You have — you and your father's family — by abandoning the LORD's commandments and chasing after the Baals.

verses.kjv: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the groves four hundred, which eat at Jezebel’s table.
verses.web: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to Mount Carmel, and four hundred fifty of the prophets of Baal, and four hundred of the prophets of the Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
verses.ct: Now send word and assemble all of Israel at Mount Carmel. Bring the 450 prophets of Baal and the 400 prophets of Asherah who eat at Jezebel's table."

verses.kjv: So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel.
verses.web: So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together to Mount Carmel.
verses.ct: So Ahab sent messengers throughout Israel and gathered all the prophets at Mount Carmel.

verses.kjv: And Elijah came unto all the people, and said, How long halt ye between two opinions? if the LORD be God, follow him: but if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
verses.web: Elijah came near to all the people, and said, “How long will you waver between the two sides? If LORD is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.” The people didn’t say a word.
verses.ct: Elijah stood before the people and said, "How long are you going to go back and forth between two choices? If the LORD is God, follow him. But if Baal is God, follow him." The people said nothing.

verses.kjv: Then said Elijah unto the people, I, even I only, remain a prophet of the LORD; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred and fifty men.
verses.web: Then Elijah said to the people, “I, even I only, am left as a prophet of LORD; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred fifty men.
verses.ct: Then Elijah told the crowd, "I'm the only prophet of the LORD left standing here. But Baal has 450 prophets.

verses.kjv: Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under: and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under:
verses.web: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it.
verses.ct: Bring us 2 bulls. Let Baal's prophets choose one, cut it into pieces, and place it on the wood — but don't light the fire. I'll prepare the other bull the same way — on the wood, with no fire underneath.

verses.kjv: And call ye on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the LORD: and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.
verses.web: You call on the name of your god, and I will call on LORD’s name. The God who answers by fire, let him be God.” All the people answered, “What you say is good.”
verses.ct: Then you call on the name of your god, and I'll call on the name of the LORD. Whichever God answers by sending fire — he is the true God." All the people shouted, "That's a fair test!"

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire under.
verses.web: Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves, and dress it first; for you are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it.”
verses.ct: Elijah told the prophets of Baal, "You go first since there are so many of you. Choose your bull, prepare it, and call on the name of your god — but don't light the fire."

verses.kjv: And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped upon the altar which was made.
verses.web: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, “Baal, hear us!” But there was no voice, and nobody answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.
verses.ct: So they took the bull given to them, prepared it, and called on Baal from morning until noon, crying out, "Baal, answer us!" But there was no voice, no response. They danced wildly around the altar they had built.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud: for he is a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing, or he is in a journey, or peradventure he sleepeth, and must be awaked.
verses.web: At noon, Elijah mocked them, and said, “Cry aloud; for he is a god. Either he is deep in thought, or he has gone somewhere, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened.”
verses.ct: Around noon, Elijah started mocking them. "Shout louder!" he said. "After all, he's a god! Maybe he's deep in thought. Maybe he's stepped away. Maybe he's on a trip. Or maybe he's asleep and needs someone to wake him up!"

verses.kjv: And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets, till the blood gushed out upon them.
verses.web: They cried aloud, and cut themselves in their way with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.
verses.ct: So they screamed even louder and slashed themselves with knives and spears, as was their custom, until blood poured down their bodies.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when midday was past, and they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
verses.web: When midday was past, they prophesied until the time of the evening offering; but there was no voice, no answer, and nobody paid attention.
verses.ct: The afternoon dragged on. They raved and carried on until the time of the evening sacrifice, but still there was no voice, no answer, no response at all.

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto all the people, Come near unto me. And all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of the LORD that was broken down.
verses.web: Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me!”; and all the people came near to him. He repaired LORD’s altar that had been thrown down.
verses.ct: Then Elijah called to all the people, "Come closer to me." They gathered around him, and he rebuilt the LORD's altar that had been torn down.

verses.kjv: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, unto whom the word of the LORD came, saying, Israel shall be thy name:
verses.web: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom LORD’s word came, saying, “Israel shall be your name.”
verses.ct: Elijah took 12 stones — one for each tribe descended from Jacob, the man to whom the LORD had said, "Your name will be Israel."

verses.kjv: And with the stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD: and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.
verses.web: With the stones he built an altar in LORD’s name. He made a trench around the altar, large enough to contain two seahs of seed.
verses.ct: With those stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD. Then he dug a trench around it, large enough to hold about 2 seahs of seed.

verses.kjv: And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid him on the wood, and said, Fill four barrels with water, and pour it on the burnt sacrifice, and on the wood.
verses.web: He put the wood in order, and cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood. He said, “Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt offering, and on the wood.”
verses.ct: He arranged the wood, cut the bull into pieces, and laid it on the wood. Then he said, "Fill 4 large jars with water and pour it over the offering and the wood."

verses.kjv: And he said, Do it the second time. And they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time. And they did it the third time.
verses.web: He said, “Do it a second time;” and they did it the second time. He said, “Do it a third time;” and they did it the third time.
verses.ct: "Do it again," he said. So they did it a 2nd time. "Do it a 3rd time," he said. And they did it a 3rd time.

verses.kjv: And the water ran round about the altar; and he filled the trench also with water.
verses.web: The water ran around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.
verses.ct: Water ran down all around the altar and even filled the trench completely.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that thou art God in Israel, and that I am thy servant, and that I have done all these things at thy word.
verses.web: At the time of the evening offering, Elijah the prophet came near, and said, “LORD, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.
verses.ct: At the time of the evening sacrifice, Elijah the prophet stepped forward and prayed, "LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel, that I am your servant, and that I have done all of this because you told me to.

verses.kjv: Hear me, O LORD, hear me, that this people may know that thou art the LORD God, and that thou hast turned their heart back again.
verses.web: Hear me, LORD, hear me, that this people may know that you, LORD, are God, and that you have turned their heart back again.”
verses.ct: Answer me, LORD! Answer me, so these people will know that you, LORD, are God, and that you are turning their hearts back to you."

verses.kjv: Then the fire of the LORD fell, and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
verses.web: Then LORD’s fire fell, and consumed the burnt offering, the wood, the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
verses.ct: Instantly, fire from the LORD blazed down from the sky. It consumed the offering, the wood, the stones, and the dirt, and it evaporated every drop of water in the trench.

verses.kjv: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces: and they said, The LORD, he is the God; the LORD, he is the God.
verses.web: When all the people saw it, they fell on their faces. They said, “LORD, he is God! LORD, he is God!”
verses.ct: When all the people saw it, they threw themselves face down on the ground and cried out, "The LORD — he is God! The LORD — he is God!"

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.
verses.web: Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal! Don’t let one of them escape!” They seized them; and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and killed them there.
verses.ct: Elijah commanded them, "Seize the prophets of Baal! Don't let a single one escape!" The people grabbed them, and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, where he put them all to death.

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink; for there is a sound of abundance of rain.
verses.web: Elijah said to Ahab, “Get up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.”
verses.ct: Then Elijah told Ahab, "Go eat and drink, because a heavy rain is coming."

verses.kjv: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees,
verses.web: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he bowed himself down on the earth, and put his face between his knees.
verses.ct: So Ahab went off to eat and drink. Meanwhile, Elijah climbed to the top of Mount Carmel, crouched down on the ground, and pressed his face between his knees.

verses.kjv: And said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.
verses.web: He said to his servant, “Go up now, and look toward the sea.” He went up, and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” He said, “Go again” seven times.
verses.ct: He told his servant, "Go look out toward the sea." The servant went and looked, then came back and said, "There's nothing there." Elijah said, "Go back." He sent him 7 times.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea, like a man’s hand. And he said, Go up, say unto Ahab, Prepare thy chariot, and get thee down, that the rain stop thee not.
verses.web: On the seventh time, he said, “Behold, a small cloud, like a man’s hand, is rising out of the sea.” He said, “Go up, tell Ahab, ‘Get ready and go down, so that the rain doesn’t stop you.’ ”
verses.ct: On the 7th time, the servant reported, "There's a small cloud rising from the sea — about the size of a man's hand." Elijah said, "Hurry! Go tell Ahab, 'Hitch up your chariot and head down before the rain stops you.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven was black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.
verses.web: In a little while, the sky grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.
verses.ct: Before long, the sky turned black with storm clouds and wind, and a torrential rain poured down. Ahab jumped in his chariot and raced toward Jezreel.

verses.kjv: And the hand of the LORD was on Elijah; and he girded up his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
verses.web: LORD’s hand was on Elijah; and he tucked his cloak into his belt and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
verses.ct: The hand of the LORD came upon Elijah. He tucked his cloak into his belt and ran ahead of Ahab's chariot all the way to the entrance of Jezreel.
